snippet: A speedy ruling to let one parent take a child overseas without an opportunity for the other parent to appeal can mean a mistaken judgment stands unfairly.
abstract: Editorial outlines details of Supreme Court case regarding child custody disputes in which parents involved live in different countries; urges Supreme Court to support principle that any parent who loses custody has right to appeal before child is taken overseas by other parent.
lead_paragraph: A speedy ruling to let one parent take a child overseas without an opportunity for the other parent to appeal can mean a mistaken judgment stands unfairly.
